intro: Gymnostachyum gracile, commonly known as the slender gymnostachyum, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, pale yellow flowers that are clustered in terminal inflorescences. Gymnostachyum gracile is typically found in humid, shaded environments such as forest understories. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and horticultural studies.
